textos_fuente.text: Our Story | Farina's Supper Club top of page Home About Catering & Events Gift Cards Menus RESERVATIONS CARRY OUT Our Story Chef  Joe Farina Farina's Supper Club is the latest venture of renowned Chef Joseph Farina, who has made a name for himself by serving up delicious Italian American classics in Chicago's neighborhood restaurants. With a focus on using only the finest imported and local ingredients, Chef Joe brings his passion, family's traditions and recipes to MIchigan City. Farina has mastered his craft at some of Chicago’s most iconic restaurants and he can be found at the most prestigious “foodie” events, including Chicago Gourmet, Taste of Travel and The Grand Chef’s Experience. He is also a favorite culinary personality on Chicago’s television and radio networks, sharing his love of Italian cuisine with the Chicagoland area. Chef Farina delights his followers with classics and new innovations like his People’s Choice, Golden Rasher Award “Best Bacon Dish” pasta winner at Chicago’s iconic Bacon fest. In 2016, he and his partners founded the Victory Restaurant Group where diners can enjoy his Chicago Italian creations at Victory Tap – South Loop, Victory Italian – River North, Victory Meat and Seafood – Elmhurst, Victory Italian – Oak Park, (opening late fall 2020),Victory in a Minute - part of the new Hayden Hall dining experience in the South Loop, and now featuring Farina's Supper Club in Michigan City located at the famous Duneland Beach Inn. Founder Yvonne Farina and Co-Founder/Culinary Director Joseph Farina look forward to sharing their passion for food, wine and entertaining in their new hometown of Michigan City. Yvonne Farina Inspired by a dinner party, Yvonne Farina blended her passion for food, wine and entertaining and pursued her hospitality career as an ambitious young woman, earning her position in a traditionally male dominated industry. Over the years, she navigated her way through numerous roles gaining a wealth of priceless experience. Prior to joining Victory Italian, Yvonne worked with the most renowned names in the Chicago's restaurant industry and was the forefront of operations at many iconic and prestigious restaurants. Yvonne discovered her passion for wine during her trips to Italy and visits to stunning wineries across the country. Her experiences motivated her to become a certified sommelier to share her knowledge for exquisite wines from around the world. ​ Yvonne’s love for the hospitality industry inspired her and her husband Chef Joseph Farina to bring their passion to their new hometown, Michigan City and look forward to sharing their enthusiasm with the Michiana community and can’t wait to meet their new neighbors. OPENING SOON Hours of Operation: Monday, Wednesday & Thursday 4 pm - 9 pm Friday & Saturday 3pm - 10pm Sunday 3pm - 9 pm Tuesday - Closed Dress Code: Casual / Casual Elegant 3311 Pottawattamie Trail Michigan City, IN  46360 219.874.7729 Info@FarinaSupperClub.com Let's Get Social Menu Reservations Catering & Events ​Order Online Gift Cards Employment Contact​ ​ Join the Club Newsletter Submit Thanks for submitting! © 2024 Grace Web Designs bottom of page

Toggle Search Art Businesses Art Clothing and Accessories Consignment Shops Florists General Retail Hotel/Resorts Kitchen and Home Other Outdoors Personal Indulgence Real Estate Services Food Health Spas and Salons Vehicle Service Non Members Public Buildings Restaurants Full Service Restaurants Healthy Eating Lighter Fare Shoes Small Business Arts & Culture Food & Drink OTHER Retail Services The Members Beachside Downtown Other Riverside Radius: Off Radius: mi Set radius for geolocation Search keyword Search Loading… 31 Supper Club 31 was conceived as a tribute to Ormond Beach featuring some of the remaining artwork of Frederick Dana Marsh, owner, and builder of the Battleship House. Several of Marsh’s Bas-Reliefs from the interior of the house can be seen adorning the walls. The Amazon, Timicuan Princess, and Timicuan Chief are formidable works of art that were fortunately saved from extinction. Our main bar and one of our proudest features were salvaged from a long forgotten speakeasy in Cicero Chicago, a suburb brutally controlled by Al Capone in the 1920’s. It was often said, “If you smell Gunpowder, then you’re in Cicero.” “ A wonderful place! Truly a step back in time to the Art Deco era. A lot of fun on weekends with dancing and live music and entertainment. Incredible food! Craft cocktails galore keeping in the spirit with the 1920s & 30s. A place not to be missed if you are in the Ormond Beach area. ” Opening Hours Monday 12 PM - 10 PM Tuesday 12 PM - 10 PM Wednesday 12 PM - 10 PM Thursday 12 PM - 10 PM Friday 12 PM - 12 PM Saturday 12 PM - 12 PM Sunday Closed Address & Contact Our Address 31 W Granada Blvd Telephone (386) 275-1625 Email JJ@31supperclub.com Web 31 Supper Club Calendar of Events Facebook Twitter Farmers Market Granada Grand Festival of the Arts Ormond Beach Celtic Festival 2022 Taste of Ormond © 2018 Copyright Ormond Beach Mainstreet .
